title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper. Creamy and comforting.
instructions: Cook spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente.
While pasta cooks, heat olive oil in a pan and fry pancetta/bacon until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk eggs and grated Parmesan together.
Drain pasta, reserving a little pasta water.
Add hot pasta to the pan with bacon (remove from heat).
Quickly stir in the egg-cheese mixture, tossing to create a creamy sauce.
Add a splash of reserved pasta water if needed.
Season with black pepper and serve immediately.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Tender chunks of grilled chicken in a rich, creamy tomato-based curry sauce with Indian spices.
ingredients: 2 tbsp tikka masala paste or spice mix
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and half of the spice mix for at least 1 hour.
Grill or pan-fry the chicken until lightly charred and cooked through.
Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until soft.
Add garlic and ginger; cook for 1 minute.
Stir in remaining spices and canned tomatoes; simmer for 10 minutes.
Add grilled chicken and cream; cook for another 5-10 minutes.
Season with salt and garnish with cilantro.
Serve hot with rice or naan.

title: Avocado Toast with Poached Egg
summary: Smashed avocado on sourdough toast topped with a perfectly poached egg and chili flakes.
instructions: Toast the bread until golden and crisp.
Mash avocado with lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Bring water to a gentle simmer and add vinegar.
Crack each egg into the water and poach for about 3 minutes.
Spread mashed avocado evenly on the toast.
Place poached eggs on top.
Sprinkle chili flakes, salt, and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately.

title: Beef Ramen
summary: Rich tonkotsu broth with tender braised beef, soft-boiled egg, nori, and spring onions.
instructions: Bring water to boil and cook eggs for 6-7 minutes for soft-boiled eggs.
Cool eggs in ice water, peel, and set aside.
In a pot, heat sesame oil and sauté garlic briefly.
Add beef broth, soy sauce, and miso paste; simmer for 5 minutes.
Cook ramen noodles according to package instructions.
Add beef slices to the broth and heat through.
Divide noodles into bowls and pour broth with beef over them.
Halve the eggs and place on top.
Garnish with spring onions and nori.
Serve hot.
